Detailed Description

cvmx-log supplies a fast log buffer implementation.

Each core writes log data to a differnet buffer to avoid synchronization overhead. Function call logging can be turned on with the GCC option "-pg".

Define Documentation

#define CVMX_LOG_DISABLE_PC_LOGGING   __attribute__((no_instrument_function))

Function Documentation

void cvmx_log_data ( uint64_t  size_in_dwords,
const uint64_t *  data 
)

Log an arbitrary block of 64bit words.

At most 255 64bit words can be logged. The words are copied into the log.

Parameters:
size_in_dwords Number of 64bit dwords to copy into the log.
data Array of 64bit dwords to copy

void cvmx_log_printf0 ( const char *  format  ) 

Log a constant printf style format string without arguments.

Parameters:
format Constant printf style format string.

Log a constant printf style format string without arguments.

The string must persist until the log is read, but the parameters are copied into the log.

Parameters:
format Constant printf style format string.

void cvmx_log_structure ( const char *  type,
void *  data,
int  size_in_bytes 
)

Log a structured data object.

Post processing will use the debugging information in the ELF file to determine how to display the structure. Max of 2032 bytes.

Example: cvmx_log_structure("cvmx_wqe_t", work, sizeof(*work));

Parameters:
type C typedef expressed as a string. This will be used to lookup the structure in the debugging infirmation.
data Data to be written to the log.
size_in_bytes Size if the data in bytes. Normally you'll use the sizeof() operator here.
